info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 3:09PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Cabarrus and south central Rowan Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 309 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Downtown Concord, or near Mt Pleasant, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, Landis, Mt Pleasant, Charlotte Motor Speedway and China Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
